Welcome to Game Development Essentials GMMT

Please begin this module by reviewing the module handbook. You will find additional information such as the weekly schedule, learning methods, and essential resources. Students are responsible for reading the content of this document. For further information, contact your instructor

View module handbook

Module Outline

This course is an introduction and foundation for students about to study Computer Game Design and Programming at British University Vietnam. It ensures that students have all the required skills, abilities and knowledge required to succeed at studying Game Design at an undergraduate level.

Learning Outcomes

By the end of this module, you will be able to:

.

Understand the founding principles of computer programming and write simple code

.

Understand what makes a game interesting and how the principles of creating new games

.

Understand and build interesting digital environments

Assessments

  • Programming Essentials: This is an individual assignment worth 40%25 of your overall mark for this module. Students will be assessed via a portfolio of code that they produce over the course and submitted at the end of week 5. (40%25)

  • Game Mechanics Metrics and Testing : This is worth 30%25 of your overall mark for this module. Students will be assessed via a submission of a boardgame created by the students. It should be developed as a part of a group and should have been iterated upon and developed over the entire course. (30%25)

  • Environmental Level Design : Students will be assessed via a submitted digital level. Students should investigate and implement not only a visually appealing level but one that is suitable for narrative and gameplay considerations. This is worth 30%25 of your overall mark for this module.

Assessment dates

Please note and manage your submission dates, they are important, and you must submit your assessments before the deadline. It is NOT possible to request an extension. The University will NOT send reminders if your submission is late or if you do not submit at all. If there are exceptional circumstances outside your control (for example, serious illness) affecting your ability to submit on time, you can download an Exceptional Circumstances (EC) formLinks to an external site..

Module Leader

.

Module Leader: David Holloway

David Holloway

David has lived and worked as an educator in Vietnam for the past 8 years and has always focused on creating a fun, inclusive and engaging learning environment for his students. David currently holds a Bachelor's and Master's degree in Computer Science and a Post Graduate Certificate for Teaching in Higher Education. He has taught many different programming languages such as C++, Python and HTML and specializes in teaching Computer Games Design within the Unreal Games Engine. David is most intrigued by Game Theory, AI Behaviour and Level Design. He has been involved with the development and growth of countless student projects within the subjects he teaches and ensures that students finish their degree with expert knowledge of their chosen field and competent communication, project management, and critical thinking skills.

week1.body:
Welcome to week 1

This week we will look at ....... By the end of this lesson you should be able to .....

.

LESSON CONTENT

  1. Lecture: Learn the fundamental building blocks of art, such as colour, shape, form, and balance. We'll pick a design object from within contemporary Vietnamese culture and analyse using these concepts.

  2. Visual studies: Learn about basic techniques and how to use your equipment. This session will include line, shape, textures, form, and shading techniques, focusing on dry media such as charcoal, pastel, and pencil. You will use trace your object using visual annotations to analyse all the individual elements.

  3. Research skill: What is the difference between visual and scientific research? Discover your own field of interest. Draw on your interests from music, literature, film, and reflect on your own daily creative flow.

  4. Digital skills: We will focus on how to get the best of your camera phone and how to use it properly. You will take a photo of your design object and edit it using Photoshop. You will also learn more about your mobile device and scanner.

.

STUDY MATERIALS

  • Virtual Studio: Your own virtual space to display your work and view others'. See weekly breakdowns for your group, and get your work show in the HALL OF FAME!

.

Ask questions, view comments, and get follow-up materials on the course noticeboard
